column4: UPDATE 1-GM CEO Barra confident about value of company's stock
column5: KANSAS CITY  Kan.  May 4 General Motors Co's  chief executive said on Monday she is confident the company will convince investors of the value of holding on to GM's stock  which has dropped nearly 9 percent since mid-March despite a $5 billion share buyback plan.

column4: GM CEO Barra confident about value of company's stock

column4: MOVES-Leveto leaves Goldman for Deutsche
column5: NEW YORK  May 4 (IFR) - Greg Leveto  a former Goldman Sachs vice president  is joining Deutsche Bank's transportation  infrastructure and energy finance group as a director  a person with knowledge of the matter said on Monday.

column4: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - May 4
column5: May 4 The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: UPDATE 4-Republican former CEO Fiorina enters 2016 race  hits Clinton
column5: WASHINGTON  May 4 Former Hewlett-Packard Co  Chief Executive Carly Fiorina on Monday announced she is running for president  and took a shot at Democratic front-runner Hillary Clinton  who she said represents a political class that Americans are "disgusted" with.

column4: China April HSBC PMI shows biggest drop in factory activity in a year
column5: BEIJING China's factories suffered their fastest drop in activity in a year in April as new orders shrank  a private business survey showed on Monday  hardening the case for fresh stimulus measures to halt a slowdown in the world's second-largest economy. | Video

column4: HSBC's HQ rethink: taxes and China relationship hold key to decision
column5: LONDON  May 3 In 1990  an assessment called Project Rainbow paved the way for HSBC to move from Hong Kong to Britain. As Europe's biggest bank now considers moving back  the same exercise offers clues to its final decision  say industry sources and analysts.

column5: May 4 Hotel  energy and financial services conglomerate Loews Corp reported a 59 percent drop in quarterly profit from continuing operations due to lower income from its energy and insurance subsidiaries.

column4: Greenlight's Einhorn slams oil frackers at Sohn conference
column5: NEW YORK Billionaire hedge fund manager David Einhorn  who often moves a stock simply by speaking its name  on Monday kicked off the year's most prominent investment conference by laying out a case against oil frackers  arguing these companies drill "lots and lots of holes" and burn through plenty of cash.

column4: SOHN CONFERENCE: Greenlight's Einhorn says Pioneer "overvalued"
column5: May 4 Greenlight Capital's David Einhorn said on Monday that oil company Pioneer Natural Resources was "dramatically overvalued"  and fell into a category of firms involved in hydraulic fracturing that are now losing money.

column4: WRAPUP 2-U.S. factory orders rebound solidly  but trend still soft
column5: WASHINGTON  May 4 New orders for U.S. factory goods recorded their biggest increase in eight months in March  boosted by demand for transportation equipment  but the underlying trend remained weak against the backdrop of a strong dollar.

column4: Sally Beauty says probing "unusual activity" on payment cards
column5: May 4 Beauty products retailer Sally Beauty Holdings Inc said it was investigating reports of "unusual activity" involving payment cards at some of its U.S. stores.

column4: Sanofi rebels make mark in AGM vote on CEO pay
column5: PARIS  May 4 Shareholders in drugs group Sanofi   which sacked its chief executive last year and appointed a new one in February  approved millions of euros in payments to both men on Monday despite a substantial rebellion by activist investors.

column4: Five U.S. aircraft landed at wrong airports since 2012: NTSB
column5: WASHINGTON Five U.S. aircraft  including a Southwest Airlines Boeing 737 and an Atlas Air Boeing 747 cargo plane  landed at the wrong airports in recent years due to preventable air traffic control errors  U.S. safety experts said on Monday.

column5: May 4 Sysco Corp reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit  hurt by higher costs and a strong dollar  a day before hearing begins on the Federal Trade Commission's motion to block the company's acquisition of rival US Foods Inc.

column4: Sysco  FTC court fight over merger may occur partly in secret
column5: In an unusual move  portions of a court fight between Sysco Corp and the Federal Trade Commission over the food distributor's bid for its largest rival may be closed to the public  including some of the opening arguments  lawyers for the two sides said in a pre-hearing conference on Friday.
